intro: Strychnos scandens, commonly known as the climbing strychnos, is a tropical shrub or vine native to regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, woody fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, orange-red aril. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
